question: 入力
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Enter</kanji> something with all your <kanji>strength</kanji> and you will look down to see that what you're doing is <vocabulary>input</vocabulary>ting data. You're inputting it right now! Into this site! The answers you <vocabulary>enter</vocabulary> into WaniKani with all your strength can be said with this word. Wow. Full circle already, and you're only on level 2. Look at you go!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>力</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Where you work, <vocabulary>input</vocabulary>ting things earns you <reading>new</reading> <reading>lock</reading>s (<ja>にゅうりょく</ja>). Not only is your job only about <vocabulary>enter</vocabulary>ing things into a computer, you're also paid exclusively in new locks. Maybe consider a career change!
